intro: Agrostemma githago var. nicaeense, commonly known as the narrowleaf cornflower, is a variant of the common cornflower. It is a flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae, characterized by its slender stems and small, bright yellow flowers. Native to the Mediterranean region, this plant thrives in dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces seeds in small, hairy capsules. The plant is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a weed in agricultural settings.
